alert.note: Alert for Giles; Lawrence; Lewis; Maury; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 06 at 1:34PM CDT until September 06 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: .Several rounds of heavy rainfall will cause ponding of water. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Giles, Lawrence, Lewis, Maury and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with some locations receiving higher amounts up to 3 inches. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Lawrenceburg, Mount Pleasant, Summertown, Ethridge, Lynnville, Henryville and Culleoka. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
